text: [5/13/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Green session. Hazy yellow. Lots of yuzu, graininess, slightly tart.
Sample at MBCC. Pours cloudy very light yellow. Aroma is sour, lots of citrus, yuzy,oranges, lemon. Taste is light, citrus refreshing.
Mbcc green. Pale yellow hazy. Grapefruity long drink on nose, sharpish greeny, citrus. Lightish bodied, clesn citruasy. Strange radler like drink.
Keg at cbc17 Green.. Hazy amber... Thin white lacing. Soft yuzu... Big massive yuzu.. Sift fruity.. Juicy yuzu
Tap @MBCC2017, Green Session. Nearly clear pale yellow, white head. Yuzu aroma. Slightly bitter yuzu flavour, light citrus peel

duft: frisk citrus lime koriander frø
smag- frisk citrus yuzu frugt svag grøn kant
Sampled @ Mikkeller Beer Celebration 2017, Green Session. Leicht trübes blass gelbes Bier. Geruch nach Ingwer, limetten, leicht säuerlich. Geschmack ist mild säuerlich, limetten, Ingwer.
Tap the MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is cloudy golden with small white head. Aromas and flavors: Sweetness, fruits, grape and some malts. Not much beer elements.

Mbcc, green session. 
Poured light golden, thin white head. 
Juicy, fruity, cucumber notes, melon as well. Same in flavor. 
Refreshing.

on tap @ Ei8ht Ball / Bellevue KY --- Aroma of lemon and grapefruit. Dirty grapefruit color, off-white head that drops to a thin rim, no lace. Taste is very light malt, medium carbonation, and a fruit finish that is more sour than bitter. An odd lager.

Draft to taster in a flight at Ei8ht Ball. Pours a slightly hazy dark golden color with a small off white head. The aroma and flavor have mildly tart citrus character, grapefruit, some lemon, herbal notes, pale malts, bready, grapefruit peel, interesting enough.

Pour at Shelton Brothers. Lots of yuzu on the nose with a touch of pils malt. Clean on the palate with the yuzu well-integrated. A little skunky as it warms. Yuzu on the finish. Light bitterness. Decent.
